io.intercom.android.sdk.push

Class IntercomPushClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.intercom.android.sdk.push.IntercomPushClient

  • public class IntercomPushClient
extends java.lang.Object

    The IntercomPushClient is responsible for taking an Intercom push message and creating a notification on the device. This class is automatically called unless your app has it's own GCM/FCM integration or uses other third party GCM/FCM integrations.

    If you have a class that extends com.google.android.gms.gcm.GcmListenerService or com.google.firebase.messaging.FirebaseMessagingService you will need to create an instance of IntercomPushClient:

    private final IntercomPushClient intercomPushClient = new IntercomPushClient();

    In the method onMessageReceived you will need to pass the message onto our push client:

    For a GCM integration:

     public void onMessageReceived(String from, Bundle message) {
     if (intercomPushClient.isIntercomPush(message)) {
         intercomPushClient.handlePush(getApplication(), message);
     } else {
         //DO HOST LOGIC HERE
     }
 }

    For an FCM integration:

     public void onMessageReceived(RemoteMessage remoteMessage) {
     Map<String, String> message = remoteMessage.getData();
     if (intercomPushClient.isIntercomPush(message)) {
         intercomPushClient.handlePush(getApplication(), message);
     } else {
         //DO HOST LOGIC HERE
     }
 }

    • Method Detail

      • handlePush

        public void handlePush(android.app.Application application,
                       android.os.Bundle message)

        Handle the Intercom push message

        This will take the cloud message bundle delivered to your GcmListenerService and create a notification.

        Parameters:
        application - A reference to the Application
        message - The bundle message which was sent to onMessageReceived in your GcmListenerService
        Since:
        3.0.5

      • handlePush

        public void handlePush(android.app.Application application,
                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> message)

        Handle the Intercom push message

        This will take the cloud message bundle delivered to your FirebaseMessagingService and create a notification.

        Parameters:
        application - A reference to the Application
        message - Pass in the remoteMessage.getData() from your onMessageReceived method.
        Since:
        3.0.5

      • isIntercomPush

        public boolean isIntercomPush(android.os.Bundle message)

        Check if the cloud message is from Intercom

        This will take the cloud message bundle delivered to your GcmListenerService and determine if it is from Intercom.

        Parameters:
        message - The bundle message which was sent to onMessageReceived in your GcmListenerService
        Returns:
        a boolean allowing you to check if this is an Intercom cloud message or not.
        Since:
        3.0.5

      • isIntercomPush

        public boolean isIntercomPush(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> message)

        Check if the cloud message is from Intercom

        This will take the cloud message bundle delivered to your FirebaseMessagingService and determine if it is from Intercom.

        Parameters:
        message - Pass in the remoteMessage.getData() from your onMessageReceived method.
        Returns:
        a boolean allowing you to check if this is an Intercom cloud message or not.
        Since:
        3.0.5
